title: So Jarvan was disabled because his ult dealt more dmg than intended
body:
Meanwhile Warwick was allowed an entire patch of single handedly winning games because of an unintended item abuse.

That logic is just, wow...

That did still leave him too strong, his abilities were functioning as intended however and while too powerful weren't dealing multiple times the appropriate damage - overtuned, but not literally broken. 

Jarvan's ult by contrast is currently bugged in a way that causes it to sometimes deal its damage multiple times - random chance to be much more powerful than  Warwick's 4.20 state.

I've been spamming {{champion:268}} recently and for the most part, everything works fine. There is just the odd missed auto in there, but not very common.

But what about when he was released? His ult almost never knocked back, dealt damage or acted as a wall his abilities sometimes didn't look like they went on CD, his soldiers miseed attack constantly, his Q failed to deal dmg, etc...

> [{quoted}](name=Rainbowe Dash,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LUGRv46z,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-12T04:42:03.977+0000)
> But what about when he was released? His ult almost never knocked back, dealt damage or acted as a wall his abilities sometimes didn't look like they went on CD, his soldiers miseed attack constantly, his Q failed to deal dmg, etc...

He WAS disabled for a little while just after release. His ult dealt damage multiple times, and could - for example - "kill" the edges of Jayce's acceleration gate multiple times, granting stupid amounts of experience for free.

A champion who does poorly on release due to bugs/poor QoL (see also: release Syndra, 23% winrate) is not the same as a champion who has, say, a 1 in 5 chance of doing 10k bonus damage to a target due to a coding mixup.

One causes the person to 100% win the game, other causes to 100% lose. They both decide the outcome of the game and should be both disabled.

Btw Azir could not deal infinite damage with ult, he could double knockup people with it but that was it. However it broke half of the abilities in the game because "everything is a minion" that is true and that was a ton more game broken than Jarvan. When he was undisabled his ult no longer functioned at all.

> [{quoted}](name=Rainbowe Dash,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LUGRv46z,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-12T18:12:24.668+0000)
> One causes the person to 100% win the game, other causes to 100% lose. They both decide the outcome of the game and should be both disabled.

What are you even arguing anymore?

You said Azir should have been disabled. He WAS disabled. Then they fixed a truckload of bugs - the ones that plagued both him and his opponents - and then re-enabled him.

Having bugs in a champion's favor is different from bugs against them. If they left Jarvan active, people would've gone into ranked and won every single game due to freelo because he's the best possible option. On the other hand, if a champion has bugs that cause poor performance (ex. release Syndra), then players can just go grab one of the other hundred-plus champions in the game instead... or the hardcore types can play her ANYWAY, and try to learn her strengths despite the handicap (which is what I did. Positive winrate on release syndra ftw).

When a bug truly *breaks* a champion, like if someone lost their ability to autoattack after recalling, then that's worth a disable because that champion can no longer contribute to their team in any way. 

Negative bugs (like the temporary inability to flash-Q for xerath, varus and vi RIGHT NOW) don't totally take a player out of the game, they just reduce a champ's strength.

> When a bug truly breaks a champion, like if someone lost their ability to autoattack after recalling, then that's worth a disable because that champion can no longer contribute to their team in any way.

For example Azir ult not existing?

But w/e not worth arguing anymore. We both have our own views on what should be disabled, and clearly Riot has their own.

His ult shouldn't be used to kill, it should be used to immobilize squishy targets before they flee and lock them down for your teammates.

There is also a huge difference between Jarvan dealing a bit more damage and an item making a champion able to kill GA, Trynd,, Kayle, etc..

Yet who was disabled? Jarvan and not the item
Bug =/= Exploit
Item synergizing too well with a particular champion =/= Exploit
It's exploiting a poor design decision. That counts. D:
